name: Sheet Pan Seafood Boil
author: Bites With Applewhite
summary: All the yummy flavors of a seafood boil with less effort. Just roast your seafood in the oven in a flavored butter sauce. Serve with crusty bread.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon lemon and herb seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
2  lobster tails, split in half lengthwise
4  andouille sausage links, cut into quarters
directions: Remove grit from clams by soaking in salt water for 20 minutes
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat with garlic, Cajun seasoning, seafood seasoning, and cayenne until garlic is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Place clams, shrimp, crab, and lobster on a sheet pan
Pour seasoned butter over and mix to ensure all is covered
Bake in the preheated oven until shrimp just turns opaque, clams open, and sausage is browned, 25 to 30 minutes
